title: Unit 4 - The World Beyond Us
subtitle: Unit 4
meanings: an eclipse of the Sun in which the moon does not cover the entire disc of the Sun
an object like a very large rock that goes round the sun like a planet
a small chunk of dust and ice that orbits, or travels around the sun
a shape that looks like an oval
a situation that happens when something, such as a plant or an animal species, has died out completely
an instrument that allows people to see distant objects
to say that something will happen in the future
a curved path followed by a planet or an object as it moves around another planet, star, moon, etc.
plan and direct the course of a ship, aircraft, or other form of transport; often by using a map
at repeated times, with equal or similar amounts of time between one time and the next
used to describe having no limits, just like space
the act of protecting or state of being protected
the plural form of 'phenomenon', which is a fact or event that is unusual
an object that orbits the Sun
to communicate with or react to
to be placed in a restricted position
being the only existing one of its type or, more generally, unusual, or special in some way
to show, express, or be a sign of something
something that happens to you that affects how you feel
in a way that attracts your attention because it is special, exciting or unusual
